page.title: 17BRAYDON SOCIAL WELFARE
page.content: If a mother is at home with young children and no transport, except when husband is home from work, she feels very isolated particularly if relations are not nearby. In a remote area it is important that Local Authority Services are aware of such families. For instance, the Health Visitor can arrange transport to take toddlers to Play Group in local village. Also voluntary helpers from the Play Group visit mothers and children at home to chat and get to know each other and their needs. Mothers appreciate such support which helps them cope with everyday problems.
